news_header: A recently detected cosmic neutrino in the Mediterranean Sea has an energy level of 220 petaelectron volts, making it the most energetic neutrino observed to date.
news_original_title: A cosmic neutrino of unknown origins smashes energy records
news_text: Detected by the KM3NeT telescope, this neutrino is believed to originate from supermassive black holes or could be the first observed cosmogenic neutrino. The KM3NeT project aims to enhance the detection of such high-energy neutrinos, which could provide insights into cosmic phenomena.
